weapons.name: Black Knife
weapons.flavorText:
Dagger once belonging to one of the assassins who murdered Godwyn the Golden on the Night of the Black Knives. 
A ritual performed on the oddly misshapen blade imbued it with the power of the stolen Rune of Death.

weapons.name: Blade Of Calling
weapons.flavorText:
Dagger given to one who set out on a journey to fulfill her duty long ago. The power of its former owner, the kindling maiden, is still apparent.
The one who walks alongside flame, Shall one day meet the road of Destined Death.

weapons.name: Bloodstained Dagger
weapons.flavorText:
Dagger with a bloodstained blade. Afflicts targets with blood loss.
As blood darkened the dagger through repeated slashing and stabbing, its blade only grew sharper and harder.

weapons.name: Celebrant's Sickle
weapons.flavorText:
Sickle decorated with flowers and many-coloured fabrics. Ceremonial tool used by dancers during the festivities of Dominula. Its attacks can slip through an enemy's guard.
Crafted from human bone.

weapons.name: Cinquedea
weapons.flavorText: Short sword given to high ranking clergymen of Farum Azula. The design celebrates a beast's five fingers, symbolic of the intelligence once granted upon their kind.

weapons.name: Crystal Knife
weapons.flavorText:
A knife made by sharpening hard crystal. Signature weapon of glintstone miners. 
Used as a tool to extract glintstone from broken rock, and as such a faint magic enwreathes the blade.

weapons.name: Dagger
weapons.flavorText:
A standard dagger with a straight blade.
Though modest in reach and capacity for harm, this weapon is light enough to jab in rapid succession and delivers devastating critical hits.

weapons.name: Duchess' Dagger
weapons.flavorText: In-game weapon description.

weapons.name: Erdsteel Dagger
weapons.flavorText:
An erdsteel dagger with a grass crest engraved upon its blade. Carried by the Erdtree royalty for self-defense in times of peace.
Though forged to a high standard, the weapon is difficult to wield.

weapons.name: Glintstone Kris
weapons.flavorText:
Ritual blade once presented to Leyndell by the Academy of Raya Lucaria to celebrate their newfound peace.
Though the weapon is embedded with precious glintstones and features Erdtree ornamentation, the undulating blade is symbolic of an ancient ritual.

weapons.name: Great Knife
weapons.flavorText:
Large knife with a broad, curved blade.
This weapon is designed to slash and rend, inflicting blood loss upon the recipient.

weapons.name: Ivory Sickle
weapons.flavorText:
Sickle fashioned from ivory. Weapon carried by aged Albunaurics.
These weapons are evidence of their dedication to the Haligtree, despite never having entered its presence.

weapons.name: Misericorde
weapons.flavorText:
Dagger favored by military physicians in white. The pointed blade is hard and sharp, making critical hits especially potent.
Medicine is mercy. and mercy upon the battlefield is ruthless. Beware the killers clothed as men of compassion.

weapons.name: Reduvia
weapons.flavorText:
Jagged dagger with a distinctive curled blade. Carried by the noble servants of the Lord of Blood.
This dagger rips the flesh as it enters, inflicting blood loss with sickening efficacy. A proud testament to the success of its vicious design, this weapon is perpetually coated in blood.

weapons.name: Parrying Dagger
weapons.flavorText:
A knife with curved handguards. Designed to parry, turning foes' attacks against them.
For master of combat who anticipate every enemy strike and counter accordingly, this weapon is all they need.

weapons.name: Scorpion's Stinger
weapons.flavorText:
Dagger fashioned from a great scorpion's tail, glistening with scarlet rot.
A ceremonial tool used by heretics, crafted from the relic of a sealed outer god.

weapons.name: Wakizashi
weapons.flavorText:
Short sword with a tempering pattern on the blade. A weapon unique to warriors of the Land of Reeds. Afflicts targets with blood loss.
These swords are considered auxiliary weapons. Yet, one man is known to wield this weapon in his left hand while using a full-sized katana in his right. A demonic swordsman known only as Okina.

weapons.name: Broadsword
weapons.flavorText:
A straight sword with a wide blade, suited to slashing attacks.
Horizontal swings boast wide attack range, making it easier to connect with foes.

weapons.name: Cane Sword
weapons.flavorText:
Beloved sword of an aged knight whose last quest was long behind him, repurposed into a walking stick. The tip is rather worn.
Though bent of back and without the brawn required even to raise the sword aloft, still he wished to meet his end with weapon in hand.

weapons.name: Carian Knight's Sword
weapons.flavorText:
Straight sword embedded with a blue glintstone. Weapon of knights sworn to Carian royalty.
These knights' swords could serve as catalysts, letting them wield sorcerous battle skills. Despite numbering fewer than twenty, this power made them a match for even the champions of gold in battle.

weapons.name: Coded Sword
weapons.flavorText:
Hidden sword once granted to the Tarnished of the Roundtable by the Two Fingers. A formless cipher comprises its blade, which deals holy damage no shield can repel.
Champions would gather at the Roundtable Hold in days long past, when the Two Fingers were masters of oration, their flesh yet full of vigor.

weapons.name: Crystal Sword
weapons.flavorText:
Sword fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human. Enwreathed with powerful magic, its attack scales with intelligence. The inscrutable Crystalians have but one clear purpose; to safeguard their crystals unto the end.
One theory posits that they yearn for the return of their creator who will carve for them new brethren.

weapons.name: Golden Epitaph
weapons.flavorText:
A sword made to commemorate the death of Godwyn the Golden, first of the demigods to die.
Infused with the humble prayer of a young boy; "O brother, lord brother, please die a true death."

weapons.name: Lazuli Glintstone Sword
weapons.flavorText:
A sword with a glintstone in its handguards. Wielded by scholars of the Lazuli Conspectus who seek to master Carian sorcery. Deals magic damage.
Apparently once used as a staff of sorcery, this sword is made of wood.

weapons.name: Longsword
weapons.flavorText:
A straight sword with a double-edged blade.
In addition to its easily-inflicted standard damage, this well-balanced weapon can also perform powerful piercing attacks.

weapons.name: Lordsworn's Straight Sword
weapons.flavorText:
Well-crafted straight sword with an illustrious design, wielded by regulars of a lord's army.
Though blackened and damaged by years of use, it appears to have otherwise been kept in a servicable condition, despite the soldiers having long since lost their minds.

weapons.name: Miquellan Knight's Sword
weapons.flavorText:
Sword forged by servants of Miquella of the Haligtree, with a design modeled after those carried by Carian knights. Instead of glintstone however, amber from the Haligtree is embedded in the blade.
A sumptuous piece, yet it has never been offered to any knight  an ill-starred sword with no master. Skill: Sacred Blade

weapons.name: Noble's Slender Sword
weapons.flavorText:
Narrow blade carried by wandering nobles. Made to be easy to wield.
Daubed with gold from tip to tail, it should fetch a good sum.

weapons.name: Ornamental Straight Sword
weapons.flavorText:
Slender straight sword patterned after an antique ornament. Superior swordsmen prefer to wield one in each hand.
After falling from grace, the dregs of the golden lineage sought power and purpose in the past.

weapons.name: Regalia Of Eochaid
weapons.flavorText:
Treasured sword of Eochaid, a lesser, long-vanished domain. The copper coloration is not to be confused for rust, but is a conduit for its wielder to move it by their will alone.
Swords of Eochaid dance through the skies

weapons.name: Rotten Crystal Sword
weapons.flavorText:
Sword fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human. It festers with scarlet rot.
Enwreathed with powerful magic, its attack scales with intelligence.

weapons.name: Short Sword
weapons.flavorText:
A short straight sword with a short blade. In addition to its reliable standard damage, this weapon also boasts powerful piercing attacks.
Lightweight amongst straight swords, this weapon is easy to wield, requiring only humble attributes.

weapons.name: Sword Of Night And Flame
weapons.flavorText:
Storied sword and treasure of Caria Manor. One of the legendary armaments.
Astrologers, who preceded the sorcerers, established themselves in mountaintops that nearly touched the sky, and considered the Fire Giants their neighbors.

weapons.name: Sword Of St Trina
weapons.flavorText:
Silver sword carried by clerics of St. Trina. Inflicts sleep ailment upon foes.
St. Trina is an enigmatic figure. Some say she is a comely young girl, others are sure he is a boy. The only certainty is that their appearance was as sudden as their disappearance.

weapons.name: Warhawk's Talon
weapons.flavorText:
Talon-swords are affixed to the legs of the Stormveil's warhawks, but this one has been repurposed for human use.
The blade is thin and lightweight so as not to obstruct the hawk's mobility.

weapons.name: Weathered Straight Sword
weapons.flavorText:
Straight sword with a rather short but wide blade.
Simple to wield, it was known as the sword of the people. Though the Erdtree styling is still visible, time has not been kind to this sword, now merely a shadow of its former self.

weapons.name: Alabaster Lord's Sword
weapons.flavorText:
Greatsword forged from a blue-white meteoric ore. The blade conceals gravity-manipulating magic.
A weapon unique to the Alabaster Lords, a race of ancients with skin of stone who were said to have risen to life when a meteor struck long ago.

weapons.name: Banished Knight's Greatsword
weapons.flavorText: A finely-crafted greatsword intricately engraved with an ancient motif. Given to knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes. Most of these knights were sent to the fringes, where they were forced to start anew with only despair for company.

weapons.name: Bastard Sword
weapons.flavorText:
A large sword with a straight blade.
This heavy sword is normally wielded with two hands, but those with sufficient strength can wield it in one alone. The hefty blade can be swung into multiple foes at once thanks to the broad, sweeping attack, making fending off crowds all the easier.

weapons.name: Blasphemous Blade
weapons.flavorText:
Sacred sword of Rykard, Lord of Blasphemy. Remains of the countless heroes he has devoured writhe upon the surface of this blade.
Now they share the same blood, bound together as family.

weapons.name: Claymore
weapons.flavorText:
A large sword with a long, straight blade. This heavy sword is usually wielded with two hands, but for those with enough strength, one is sufficient.
In addition to the heavy sweeping attacks, it can also make a heavy piercing thrust making this a versatile weapon.

weapons.name: Dark Moon Greatsword
weapons.flavorText:
A Moon Greatsword, bestowed by a Carian queen upon her spouse to honor long-standing tradition. One of the legendary armaments.

Ranni's sigil is a full moon, cold and leaden, and this sword is but a beam of its light.

weapons.name: Death's Poker
weapons.flavorText:
Barbed rod carried by Deathbirds.
The birds are graveyard fire keepers; it is said they rake out the ashen remains of the dead from their kilns.

weapons.name: Flamberge
weapons.flavorText:
Greatsword featuring a flame-like undulation. Shreds enemy flesh, inducing blood loss.

Scarlet rot is kept at bay with flame at Redmane Castle, and as such, this beloved sword of Jerren's eventually became the symbol of the castle itself.

weapons.name: Forked Greatsword
weapons.flavorText:
Oddly shaped greatsword wielded by imps. 
The gently undulating forked blade is known as an "imp's tongue" and causes blood loss.

weapons.name: Gargoyle's Blackblade
weapons.flavorText:
Bronze greatsword wielded by Valiant Gargoyles mended with blackened corpse wax. Deals holy damage.
Such is the mark of those who serve Maliketh, the Black Blade.

weapons.name: Gargoyle's Greatsword
weapons.flavorText:
Bronze greatsword wielded by Valiant Gargoyles.
Just like the wielder, the missing parts have been mended with corpse wax; a patchwork of champions.

weapons.name: Golden Order Greatsword
weapons.flavorText:
Greatsword made of light, modeled after the Elden Ring itself. Forged by King Consort Radagon to proudly symbolize the tenets of the Golden Order. One of the legendary armaments.
Telltale signs betray that this was once the greatsword bequeathed to him by his first wife, Rennala.

weapons.name: Helphen's Steeple
weapons.flavorText:
Greatsword patterned after the black steeple of the Helphen, the lampwood which guides the dead of the spirit world.
The lamplight is similar to grace in appearance, only it is said that it can only be seen by those who met their death in battle.

weapons.name: Inseparable Sword
weapons.flavorText:
Sword forged by compounding silver and gold. A sacred weapon to hunt Those Who Live in Death. Deals holy damage.
The inseparable twins found solace in the Golden Order, the only institution not to revile them as accursed beings.

weapons.name: Iron Greatsword
weapons.flavorText:
A coarse weapon to which polishing is a foreign concept. A coarse weapon to which polishing is a foreign concept.
Weighty even among others of its class, the impact of each strike is sure to be felt.

weapons.name: Knight's Greatsword
weapons.flavorText:
Greatsword bestowed upon skilled swordsmen in the demigods' service, and yet had no rank or title.
Featuring a long grip enabling a dual-handed use, this weapon was designed to dispatch larger foes. Being charged with such a duty was undoubtedly a great honor.

weapons.name: Lordsworn's Greatsword
weapons.flavorText:
Well-crafted straight sword with an illustrious design, wielded by regulars of a lord's army.
Through blackened and damaged by years of use, it appears to have otherwise been kept in a serviceable condition, despite the soldiers having long since lost their minds.

weapons.name: Marais Executioner's Sword
weapons.flavorText:
Storied sword of House Marais, the family of executioners who presided over the Shaded Castle. One of the legendary armaments.
Elemer of the Briar, the Bell Bearing Hunter, snatched the sword from the site of his looming execution, and furnished it with battle skills from his home of Eochaid..

weapons.name: Ordovis's Greatsword
weapons.flavorText:
Greatsword of Ordovis, one of the two honored as foremost among the Crucible Knights.
This sword is imbued with an ancient holy essence. Its red tint exemplifies the nature of primordial gold, said to be close in nature to life itself.

weapons.name: Sacred Relic Sword
weapons.flavorText:
Sword wrought from the remains of a god who should have lived a life eternal.
Thoughts on what the weapon portends are many and varied. Some consider it the mark of a great sin, or a sign of great devastation. Some think of it as the end of an age, while others; the beginning.

weapons.name: Sword Of Milos
weapons.flavorText:
Sinister greatsword fashioned from a giant's backbone.
Milos was undersized for a giant, and was viewed as sullied and terribly grotesque.

weapons.name: Wylder's Greatsword
weapons.flavorText: In-game weapon description.

weapons.name: Godslayer's Greatsword
weapons.flavorText: Sacred sword of the Gloam-Eyed Queen who controlled the Godskin Apostles before her defeat at the hands of Maliketh.

weapons.name: Grafted Blade Greatsword
weapons.flavorText:
The storied sword of Castle Morne. A revenger's weapon, it is burdened with oceans of anger and regret. One of the legendary armaments.

A lone surviving champion from a country now vanished was so determined to continue fighting that he claimed the swords of an entire clan of warriors.

weapons.name: Greatsword
weapons.flavorText:
A coarse iron lump of an ultra greatsword. Mows down foes by utilizing its incredible weight.
Though handling it likely requires the wielder to have surpassed the realm of the merely human, it is precisely for this reason the weapon is used to slaughter even inhuman foes.

weapons.name: Maliketh's Black Blade
weapons.flavorText:
Maliketh's black blade which once harbored the power of the Rune of Death. A sad shadow of its former glory.
After a fragment of Death was stolen on that fateful night, Maliketh bound the blade within his own flesh, such that none might ever rob Death again.

weapons.name: Royal Greatsword
weapons.flavorText:
Greatsword decorated in royal Carian Style. Favored weapon of Blaidd the Half-Wolf.
In defiance of the fate he was born to, Blaidd swore to serve no master but Ranni. As proof the sword was imbued with a cold magic at the moment oath was sworn.

weapons.name: Ruins Greatsword
weapons.flavorText:
Originally rubble from a ruin which fell from the sky, this surviving fragment was honed into a weapon. One of the legendary armaments.
The ruin it came from crumbled when struck by a meteorite, as such this weapon harbors its destructive power.

weapons.name: Starscourge Greatsword
weapons.flavorText:
Curved greatswords of black steel wielded by General Radahn. A pair of weapons decorated with a lion mane motif.
Radahn earned considerable renown as the Starscourge in his youth, and it is said that it was during this time he engraved the gravity crest upon these blades.

weapons.name: Troll's Golden Sword
weapons.flavorText:
Sword given to the lesser giants who fought for the Erdtree during the War against the Giants long ago.
Though the giants have lost their minds, they stay inseparable from their swords that are in sad shapesuch that the gold plating had flaked away.

weapons.name: Troll Knight's Sword
weapons.flavorText:
Greatsword embedded with a blue glintstone. Weapon of the trolls in service to the royal family of Caria.
Called into service when the Queen invoked an oath they swore, the trolls are treated as true knights of Caria, and fight arm in arm with their human comrades.

weapons.name: Watchdog's Greatsword
weapons.flavorText:
Stone greatsword wielded by Erdtree Burial Watchdogs.
Though decorated with the watchman's eye, the pupil was taken by graverobbers and is now hollow, leaving this sword a mere lump of stone.

weapons.name: Zweihander
weapons.flavorText:
Just about the largest sword a mere man is capable of swinging. True to its name, it is designed to be wielded in both hands, but those of merely ordinary strength will still struggle to do so.
The long blade is heavy and sharp, sending foes reeling back with its broader strokes, while also capable of a devastating piercing thrust.

weapons.name: Antspur Rapier
weapons.flavorText:
Spur of a giant ant which has been fashioned into a rapier. The blade drips with scarlet rot.
Scarlet rot is an old legend, of which Maleigh Marais of the Shaded Castle was a private believer. And indeed, he eventually found his own personal goddess.

weapons.name: Cleanrot Knight's Sword
weapons.flavorText:
Piercing sword of the Cleanrot Knights who fought alongside Malenia, Blade of Miquella.
Mainly used as a backup weapon, in combination with a long-handled armament.

weapons.name: Estoc
weapons.flavorText:
Large piercing sword with a long, hard bladed edge which is also capable of slashing attacks.
For its large size, it can be wielded rather nimbly, leaving little opportunity for the enemy to counter.

weapons.name: Frozen Needle
weapons.flavorText: A razor-thin piercing blade of ice Forged by Ijii, the carian Royal Blackmith.

weapons.name: Noble's Estoc
weapons.flavorText:
Estoc carried by wandering nobles. Made to be easy to wield.
Daubed with gold from tip to tail, it should fetch a good sum.

weapons.name: Rapier
weapons.flavorText:
A piercing sword with a sharp, slender blade. In addition to this weapon's thrusting attack prowess, it also boasts the ability to be used while guarding with a shield.
As one of the smaller piercing swords, quick successive thrust area easy to perform, but without a cutting edge, it cannot be used for slashing attacks.

weapons.name: Rogier's Rapier
weapons.flavorText:
Piercing sword of superior quality, featuring intricate ornamentation. Signature weapon of the sorcerer Rogier.
High dexterity is required to wield the blade to its full potential, but mastery is a sight to behold, characterized by a flowing style which excels in successive attacks.

weapons.name: Bloody Helice
weapons.flavorText:
Ominous piercing sword with a winding blade. Carried by the noble servants of the Lord of Blood.
Designed to bore into flesh, causing severe blood loss at the wound. The extracted blood trickles gracefully down the length of the blade.

weapons.name: Dragon King's Cragblade
weapons.flavorText:
Piercing Gravel Stone sword containing primeval lightning. A portion of the Dragonlord's power, gained from a remembrance.
This weapon commands great power over the paltry, mortal dragons of today.

weapons.name: Godskin Stitcher
weapons.flavorText:
Elegant piercing sword with a celadon colored blade wielded by Godskin Nobles.
The nobles possess skill with the sword unmatched by any lowborn. Despite its size, successive attacks from this weapon are swifter than the eye can follow.

weapons.name: Great Epee
weapons.flavorText:
Large rapier featuring a thin, sharp blade. Commonly used in life or death duels.
Like its smaller counterparts, it is made for thrusting attacks, and can be used while guarding with a shield.

weapons.name: Bandit's Curved Sword
weapons.flavorText:
Curved sword with a light, crescent-shaped blade. Used by the bandits who ran rampant in the wake of the Shattering.
Most of the blade is now darkened and covered in rust, but with enough dexterity this weapon may still stand up to some use.

weapons.name: Beastman's Curved Sword
weapons.flavorText:
Curved sword forged of dull iron wielded by the beastmen of Farum Azula.
The blade is heavy but well-balanced. Comparatively easy to wield for the damage it delivers.

weapons.name: Eclipse Shotel
weapons.flavorText:
Storied sword and treasure of Castle Sol that depicts an eclipsed sun drained of color. One of the legendary armaments.
In Sol, the sight of an eclipse inspires a dreadful awe, preventing an onlooker from averting his gaze.

weapons.name: Falchion
weapons.flavorText:
A curved sword with a single-sided blade. Delivers slashing attacks with its sharp blade, but is ineffective against thick armor and hides covered in tough scales.
Wielders of the weapon employ a unique style that enhances attacks with spinning motions.

weapons.name: Flowing Curved Sword
weapons.flavorText: Legends speak of a master of the sword garbed in blue, and his curved blade that was patterned after flowing water.

weapons.name: Grossmesser
weapons.flavorText:
Curved sword boasting a large blade.
A thoroughly reliable choice of weapon for those who can master its particulars.

weapons.name: Magma Blade
weapons.flavorText:
Curved sword with a blade fashioned from the lava of Mt. Gelmir. An armament of the man-serpents, impossible for a human to have made.
Deals fire damage.

weapons.name: Mantis Blade
weapons.flavorText:
A curved sword with a blade at both ends wielded by the Cemetery Shades, the insect-ridden grave keepers. 
The blade is thin and sharp, and strong attack unleashes a far-reaching slash.

weapons.name: Nox Flowing Sword
weapons.flavorText:
A grim weapon wielded by swordsmen of the Eternal City, this shotel has a blade as fine as a needle.
Forged from the liquid metal of a Silver Tear, it is thoroughly tempered until hardened.

weapons.name: Scavenger's Curved Sword
weapons.flavorText:
Weapon carried by corpse pillagers who prowl the sites of old battles. Weapon carried by corpse pillagers who prowl the sites of old battles.
The blade is tacky with blood and covered in hefty nicks, making it totally uneven. Life can be sinister indeed.

weapons.name: Scimitar
weapons.flavorText:
A curved sword with a single-sided blade.
Smaller in size than most curved swords, it carves into enemies with quick, sharp cuts.

weapons.name: Serpent-god's Curved Sword
weapons.flavorText: Curved sword fashioned in the image of an ancient serpent deity and tool of a forgotten religion practiced on Mt. Gelmir.

weapons.name: Shamshir
weapons.flavorText:
Curved sword with a thin blade of ample length. Light of weight despite its larger size, its slicing attacks come in rapid succession.
A devastatingly powerful weapon in the hands of a skilled swordsman.

weapons.name: Shotel
weapons.flavorText:
Curved sword with a severely hooked blade. Its attacks can slip through an enemy's guard.
Made to hunt down humans, this weapon requires high dexterity to wield efficiently.

weapons.name: Wing Of Astel
weapons.flavorText:
Sword fashioned from a delicate wing, suffused with the magic of the stars.
Crafted from a relic of the Naturalborn of the Void who is said to have assailed the Eternal City.

weapons.name: Beastman's Cleaver
weapons.flavorText:
Curved greatsword of colossal size forged of dull iron and wielded by the beastmen of Farum Azula.
The blade is incredibly heavy, but well-balanced. Comparatively easy to wield for the damage it delivers. It's clear the beastmen possess knowledge beyond human ken.

weapons.name: Bloodhound's Fang
weapons.flavorText:
Curved greatsword with a gently undulating blade wielded by Bloodhound Knights.
A fearsome blade capable of brutal airborne attacks.

weapons.name: Dismounter
weapons.flavorText: This curved greatsword wielded by the brawny sellswords of Kaiden combines the blades of a scimitar with the heft of a hatchet.

weapons.name: Magma Wyrm's Scalesword
weapons.flavorText:
Curved greatsword wielded by Magma Wyrms. The shape resembles a dragon's jaw and is covered in hard scales.
It's said these land-bound dragons were once human heroes who partook in dragon communion, a grave transgression for which they were cursed to crawl the earth upon their bellies, shadows of their former selves.

weapons.name: Monk's Flameblade
weapons.flavorText:
Curved sword with a flickering flame motif. Wielded by the Fire Monks who came from the Mountaintops of the Giants.
The monks came to the land of Liurnia in pursuit of a fugitive who stole their fire.

weapons.name: Morgott's Cursed Sword
weapons.flavorText:
Warped blade of shifting hue used by Morgott, the Omen King.
The accursed blood that Morgott recanted and sealed away reformed into this blade.

weapons.name: Omen Cleaver
weapons.flavorText:
Heavy-bladed curved sword of colossal size awarded to Omen as a tool of war. This weapon is made to take advantage of brute strength.
The pattern etched upon the blade is the remnant of a deteriorating malediction. Indeed, when bestowing a weapon, preparations must be made for taking it away.

weapons.name: Onyx Lord's Greatsword
weapons.flavorText:
Greatsword forged from golden-hued meteoric ore. The blade conceals gravity-manipulating magic.
A weapon unique to the Onyx Lords, a race of ancients with skin of stone who were said to have risen to life when a meteor struck long ago.

weapons.name: Zamor Curved Sword
weapons.flavorText:
Weapon wielded by the knights of Zamor who earned great renown during the War against the Giants.
In apparent devotion to winter, the curved blade is styled after an icy wind and imbued with a powerful frost effect.

weapons.name: Dragonscale Blade
weapons.flavorText:
A weapon made by sharpening a Gravel Stone scale, thought to be the source of ancient dragon immortality, into an unclouded blade.
Alas, the Dragonkin Soldiers never attained immortality, and perished as decrepit, pale imitations of their skyborn kin.

weapons.name: Hand Of Malenia
weapons.flavorText:
Blade built into Malenia's prosthetic arm. Through consecration it is resistant to rot.
Malenia's war prosthesis symbolized her victories. Some claim to have seen wings when the weapon was raised aloft; wings of fierce determination that have never known defeat.

weapons.name: Meteoric Ore Blade
weapons.flavorText:
Katana forged from meteoric ore to dispatch lifeforms born of falling stars. Deals magic damage.
The blade is weighty, known to deliver slashes of such ferocity that the impact is said to resemble the crash of a falling meteor.

weapons.name: Moonveil
weapons.flavorText:
Katana forged of glintstone. Masterpiece of a Sellian swordsmith. 
Light enwreathes the blade when sheathed, explaining its Moonveil moniker.

weapons.name: Nagakiba
weapons.flavorText:
Katana with a ferociously long blade. Signature weapon of Yura, hunter of Bloody Fingers.
Reminiscent of a reinforced spear, its imposing length can be put to good use with powerful thrusting attacks.

weapons.name: Rivers Of Blood
weapons.flavorText:
Weapon of Okina, swordsman from the Land of Reeds. A cursed weapon that has felled countless men.
When Mohg, the Lord of Blood, first felt Okina's sword, and madness, upon his flesh, he had a proposal, to offer Okina the life of a demon, whose thirst would never go unsated.

weapons.name: Serpentbone Blade
weapons.flavorText:
Sinister katana modeled after a serpent bone.
The densely packed row of spines that jut away from the cutting edge are coated in a lethal poison.

weapons.name: Uchigatana
weapons.flavorText:
A katana with a long single-edged curved blade. A unique weapon wielded by the samurai from the Land of Reeds.
The blade, with its undulating design, boasts extraordinary sharpness, and its slash attacks cause blood loss.

weapons.name: Eleonora's Poleblade
weapons.flavorText:
Twinned naginata forged in the Land of Reeds. Chosen weapon of Eleonora, Violet Bloody Finger.
Her mastery of the sword was such that her onslaught was likened to a whirlwind, but now her legacy is stained by accursed blood.

weapons.name: Gargoyle's Black Blades
weapons.flavorText:
Bronze twinblade wielded by Valiant Gargoyles, mended with blackened corpse wax. Deals holy damage.
Such is the mark of those who serve Maliketh, the Black Blade.

weapons.name: Gargoyle's Twinblade
weapons.flavorText:
Bronze twinblade wielded by Valiant Gargoyles.
Just like the wielder, the missing parts have been mended with corpse wax; a patchwork of champions.

weapons.name: Godskin Peeler
weapons.flavorText:
Unique twinblade wielded by Godskin Apostles characterized by its disturbing design. One end features a sickle for slicing attacks while the other boasts a winding spike for boring into flesh.
Much skill is required to wield this weapon due to its asymmetric nature.

weapons.name: Twinblade
weapons.flavorText:
A sword with blades on both sides of the hilt.
Can be wielded with a single hand, but its true strength is enabled with dual-handed spinning attacks.

weapons.name: Twinned Knight Swords
weapons.flavorText:
An attractive twinblade of fine make that prizes the chivalric way.
Can be wielded with a single hand, but its true strength is unlocked with dual-handed spinning attacks.

weapons.name: Battle Axe
weapons.flavorText:
A thick, heavy blade attached to a handle. A versatile, standard weapon.
Capable of powerful attacks thanks to the weighty blade, these weapons are also regarded for their powerful charge attacks.

weapons.name: Celebrant's Cleaver
weapons.flavorText:
Cleaver decorated with many-colored fabrics. Ceremonial tool used by dancers during the festivities of Dominula, Windmill Village.
Crafted from human bone. Grants trace amounts of runes upon landing attacks.

weapons.name: Forked Hatchet
weapons.flavorText:
Peculiar hatchet wielded by imps.
The gently undulating forked blade is known as an "imp's tongue" and causes blood loss.

weapons.name: Hand Axe
weapons.flavorText:
Commonly known as a hatchet, this smaller variety of axe is an everyday work tool.
Despite its short reach, it is easy to handle, exceling in successive attacks.

weapons.name: Highland Axe
weapons.flavorText:
Single-sided axe used by the warriors of the highlands.
Brave combatants begin battle by crying out their names. Roars are enhanced by this weapon.

weapons.name: Icerind Hatchet
weapons.flavorText:
A hatchet with a frost-coated blade. One of several gifts given by Castle Sol in the distant north.
Known as "freezing fog," the blade is thought to be a dragon's scale. Inflicts a powerful frost effect.

weapons.name: Iron Cleaver
weapons.flavorText:
Fairly large iron cleaver, commonly used by the maltreated Misbegotten.
Steeped in resentment, these weapons are swung wildly and relentlessly, often after rushing up to foes.

weapons.name: Jawbone Axe
weapons.flavorText:
Axe made from a herbivore's skull. Weapon of the ancestral followers who disdain metal.
This axe is more of a bludgeon; it forgoes a bladed edge, instead using the beast's molar teeth to buffet foes, dealing strike damage.

weapons.name: Ripple Blade
weapons.flavorText: Unique weapon wielded by young Albinaurics, this sword is modelled after the ripples that are thought to be the origin of their species.

weapons.name: Rosus' Axe
weapons.flavorText:
Usher of Death, Rosus, who shows the path to the catacombs throughout the Lands Between, is depicted on this ritual axe.
The dead easily lose their way, and have always been in sore need of a guiding hand.

weapons.name: Sacrificial Axe
weapons.flavorText: Hatchet used in ancient sacrificial rite. A Deathbird is depicted as a malevolent deity.

weapons.name: Stormhawk Axe
weapons.flavorText:
Battle axe designed to resemble a hawk, with its wings comprising the blade. Signature weapon of warriors who strive to remain one with the storm, despite being so far from their place of birth.
Their hearts are proud, and thereby easily undone.

weapons.name: Warped Axe
weapons.flavorText:
Oversized double-headed axe with a bizarre, almost melted appearance.
Brute strength is the only thing required to wield this weapon, which appears to have taken quite the beating itself.

weapons.name: Axe Of Godrick
weapons.flavorText:
Greataxe wielded by Godrick the Grafted. This golden battleaxe is emblazoned with the figure of a beast, representing the strength of Godfrey, First Elden Lord and patriarch of the golden lineage.
"I command thee kneel! For I am the lord of all that is golden!"

weapons.name: Butchering Knife
weapons.flavorText:
Huge carving knife made to cleanly butcher the human body.
Signature weapon of the Ogress Anastasia, known to have eaten countless Tarnished while disguised as a Finger Maiden.

weapons.name: Crescent Moon Axe
weapons.flavorText:
Greataxe with a large, arcing blade and long handle. The "Crescent Moon" of its name is said to have been spurred by nostalgia.
Specializes in sweeping through foes by making use of its long handle.

weapons.name: Executioner's Greataxe
weapons.flavorText:
Bulky cleaver welded to a long haft. Said to have been used to dispatch the remnants of defeated armies, felling them like timber.
Perhaps that is the reason it excels at critical hits.

weapons.name: Gargoyle's Black Axe
weapons.flavorText:
Bronze greataxe wielded by Valiant Gargoyles, mended with blackened corpse wax. Deals holy damage.
Such is the mark of those who serve Maliketh, the Black Blade.

weapons.name: Gargoyle's Great Axe
weapons.flavorText:
Just like the wielder, the missing parts have been mended with corpse wax; a patchwork of champions.
Just like the wielder, the missing parts have been mended with corpse wax; a patchwork of champions.

weapons.name: Greataxe
weapons.flavorText:
Greataxe akin to a huge lump of iron. Recognized as the weapon of choice of badland chieftains.
Too heavy to be wielded by those of merely ordinary strength, blows from this axe will flatten enemies, and the force of its charged attack is a sight to behold.

weapons.name: Great Omenkiller Cleaver
weapons.flavorText:
The blade of this huge, loathsome cleaver comprises a row of amputated Omen horns. Weapon of slaughter wielded by Omen killers.
The hideous horns cause blood loss, adding vibrant colors to the ongoing mayhem.

weapons.name: Longhaft Axe
weapons.flavorText:
Large iron axe with a long handle. Weapon of the maltreated Misbegotten.
Making use of the force generated by its length, this weapon's resentment-charged blows are difficult to stop.

weapons.name: Rusted Anchor
weapons.flavorText:
A rusty anchor wielded as a weapon. Each of its four flukes is thick and sharp, enabling piercing attacks.
While the Tarnished left the Lands Between with their Lord, one boat alone was said to have been left behind.

weapons.name: Winged Greathorn
weapons.flavorText:
Distinctive horn suffused with the power of ancestral spirits. This large, wing-shaped specimen is wielded as a weapon of spirit worship.
In the ancestral spirit-worshipping faith, these are considered envoys' wings, made to reap the lives of beings which experience no sprouting.

weapons.name: Club
weapons.flavorText:
A thick, solid lump of wood. Wielding this striking weapon requires no skill.
A simple, primitive weapon that requires only brute strength and persistence to hammer your foe into the ground.

weapons.name: Curved Club
weapons.flavorText:
Hard, curved club, shaped like a crescent moon.
Wielded instead of a curved sword by Albinaurics lacking dexterity. The only point of similarity between the two is the shape.

weapons.name: Envoy's Horn
weapons.flavorText:
Golden horn of the Oracle Envoys. Profoundly weighty, its blows are sure to be felt.
Originally an instrument, but one that cannot be sounded by a mere human. Or perhaps it is too early to sound the call.

weapons.name: Hammer
weapons.flavorText:
Hammer comprised of a large stone affixed to a metal handle. Originally a blacksmith's tool.
The art of smithing is said to have originated among the giants. This weapon's striking attacks boast ample weight behind them.

weapons.name: Mace
weapons.flavorText:
An iron bludgeon with sharp protrusions.
Striking attacks have few drawbacks, potent as they are at breaking through guards and stances, Most suited to head on slugging matches.

weapons.name: Marika's Hammer
weapons.flavorText:
Stone hammer made in the lands of the Numen, outside the Lands Between. The tool with which Queen Marika shattered the Elden Ring and Radagon attempted to repair it.
The hammer partially broke upon shattering the Ring, becoming splintered with rune fragments.

weapons.name: Monk's Flamemace
weapons.flavorText: Battle hammer made to resemble flickering flames. Signature weapon of the Fire Monks, who hail from the Mountaintops of the Giants.

weapons.name: Morning Star
weapons.flavorText:
Battle hammer comprised of a globe attached to a handle. Though a bludgeon dealing strike damage, the appellative star is covered in spikes which cause blood loss.
Ironic given its graceful name, this weapon often reeks of blood.

weapons.name: Nox Flowing Hammer
weapons.flavorText:
Mace shaped like a suspended metal droplet wielded by monks of the Eternal City.
Forged from liquid metal from a Silver Tear, it is thoroughly tempered until hardened.

weapons.name: Ringed Finger
weapons.flavorText:
Bludgeon made of an enormous finger sheathed in several heavy rings. Thought to have been cut from an ancestor of the Fingercreeper.
Some life yet remains in this legacy of an ancient act of blasphemy, as evidenced by the barely perceptible warmth it still exudes.

weapons.name: Scepter Of The All-knowing
weapons.flavorText:
Scepter in the form of a hand grasping a pearl. Signature weapon of Sir Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing. The pearl stands for the world, the heavens, and an eye, representing the many forms of knowledge, never fully attainable.
Even knowing that, the All-Knowing's hand grasps for it.

weapons.name: Spiked Club
weapons.flavorText:
A club with beast fangs wrapped around the striking end. The uneven spread of fangs causes blood loss.
Given only to the toughest of demi-humans, this weapon is a badge of honor. Or so the demi-humans believe.

weapons.name: Stone Club
weapons.flavorText:
Signature weapon of battlemages, hewn from hard glintstone. This club is much heavier than its size suggests, but has no magic power.
So that they not lose sight of the true essence of combat, battlemages prefer to feel the impact of their blows, fighting their opponents hand to hand.

weapons.name: Varre's Bouquet
weapons.flavorText:
A steel mace resembling a charming bouquet of roses. Each petal has a sharpened edge, leaving the roses perpetually colored with blood.
This weapon reflects White Mask Varr's manner of speech rather well, enticing in its splendor, but full of deadly consequence.

weapons.name: Warpick
weapons.flavorText:
Battle hammer with a hard protruding beak. A pickaxe designed for combat, in essence.
A simple but highly effective weapon, the weighty piercing attack casually rips through metal armor.

weapons.name: Bastard's Stars
weapons.flavorText:
Flail which deals magic damage, having been imbued with power by the remembrance of Astel.
Formed of the same many-colored star debris that comprised the form of the Naturalborn of the Void.

weapons.name: Chainlink Flail
weapons.flavorText:
A spiked iron tube attached by a chain wielded by Mad Pumpkin Heads.
Especially large for a flail, wielding it requires more strength than it does dexterity.

weapons.name: Family Heads
weapons.flavorText:
Three bludgeoning copper heads attached to a handle by chains. Signature weapon of Necromancer Garris, the heretical sage.
The heads were made to resemble those of his wife and two children.

weapons.name: Flail
weapons.flavorText:
Weapon consisting of a bludgeoning head attached to a handle by chain. The iron ball is spiked and induces blood loss.
Blows from this weapon cannot be parried. The charge attack whirls the iron ball around for increased force before striking.

weapons.name: Nightrider Flail
weapons.flavorText:
A flail with two additional bludgeoning heads. Weapon of the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds.
The large spikes make it highly effective at inducing blood loss, but also demand higher dexterity to wield.

weapons.name: Battle Hammer
weapons.flavorText:
Large iron great hammer designed for gladiatorial combat. Used by duelists who were exiled from the colosseum.
Weighty enough to crush armor and its wearer alike.

weapons.name: Beastclaw Greathammer
weapons.flavorText:
Greathammer with a striking end modelled to resemble five beastly claws.
The black nails protruding from golden fur are said to represent Serosh, Lord of Beasts, who went to become King Godfrey's Regent.

weapons.name: Brick Hammer
weapons.flavorText:
Weapon made from an ordinary stone brick. Wielded by a laborer who lead a rebellion, and later become a champion himself.
Even among other bludgeons of its size, this weapon is especially weighty. The strength of a giant is required to wield it.

weapons.name: Celebrant's Skull
weapons.flavorText:
Large bludgeon decorated with flowers and many-colored fabrics. Ceremonial tool used by dancers during the festivities of Dominula, Windmill Village.
The striking end is a skull too large in size to be human.

weapons.name: Cranial Vessel Candlestand
weapons.flavorText:
Candlestand used in worship of Birac, the most hallowed Monk Prelate of the Giants' Flame.
Concerned over the lazy arrogance with which the monks treated the Flame, Birac severed his own head as a lesson to the others, intending it be used as a candlestand. His faith yet smolders from within the cranial vessel.

weapons.name: Curved Great Club
weapons.flavorText:
Large curved club of hard wood, shaped like a crescent moon.
Wielded by Albinaurics lacking the dexterity demanded by a curved sword, and who prefer the added weight and destructive force.

weapons.name: Devourer's Scepter
weapons.flavorText:
Scepter in the shape of a serpent devouring the world. This weapon will one day become the very symbol of the Lord of Blasphemy. One of the legendary armaments.
A vision of the future briefly seen by Rykard in his final moments before being devoured by the great serpent.

weapons.name: Envoy's Long Horn
weapons.flavorText:
Long golden horn of the Oracle Envoys. Profoundly weighty, its blows are sure to be felt.
Originally an instrument, but one that cannot be sounded by a mere human. Or perhaps it is too early to sound the call.

weapons.name: Great Mace
weapons.flavorText:
Huge bludgeon with sharp protrusions. An enlarged version of its smaller cousin.
Maintains all the advantages of smaller bludgeons, boasting few deficiencies while being very capable at breaking enemy guards and stances.
A shrewd choice for simple slugging matches.

weapons.name: Great Stars
weapons.flavorText:
Huge bludgeon with three stars at the striking end. Though primarily a striking weapon, the stars' spikes cause blood loss.
A blood-stained star is an ill omen, a fact not lost upon those against whom this weapon is brought to bear.

weapons.name: Greathorn Hammer
weapons.flavorText:
Huge thick horn carved with tree ring-like markings adapted into a bludgeoning weapon. Wielded by ancestral follower warriors.
The ancient horn is imbued with the power of ancestral spirits.

weapons.name: Large Club
weapons.flavorText:
A thick, solid lump of wood. Wielding this striking weapon requires no skill.
A simple, primitive weapon that requires only brute strength to swing about.

weapons.name: Pickaxe
weapons.flavorText:
Large pickaxe designed to crack thick bedrock. Tool of sturdy miners.
Not originally designed as a weapon, but very adept at piercing armor.
"Little wretches, do you think your armor harder than stone?"

weapons.name: Rotten Battle Hammer
weapons.flavorText:
Large iron great hammer designed for gladiatorial combat, now festering with scarlet rot.
Weighty enough to crush armor and its wearer alike.

weapons.name: Axe Of Godfrey
weapons.flavorText: Weapon of Godfrey, Elden Lord. It was broken in a battle fought as leader of the Tarnished during the Long March. This weapon is symbolic of Godfrey's vow to conduct himself as a lord, later becoming an emblem of the golden lineage. In the days of the past, a crown was warranted with strength.

weapons.name: Dragon Greatclaw
weapons.flavorText:
Weapon said to have been whittled from the claw of a great, ancient dragon, wielded by grotesque Tree Sentinels who yet serve the Erdtree.
The claw is enwreathed with lightning, and tears through the dragons' feeble descendants with ease.

weapons.name: Duelist Greataxe
weapons.flavorText:
Greataxe designed for gladiatorial combat. Used by duelists who were exiled from the colosseum.
A weapon reserved for duelist champions, the charge attack is particularly ferocious.

weapons.name: Envoy's Greathorn
weapons.flavorText:
Fanned golden horn of the Oracle Envoys. Profoundly weighty, its blows are sure to be felt.
Originally an instrument, but one that cannot be sounded by a mere human. Or perhaps it is too early to sound the call.

weapons.name: Fallingstar Beast Jaw
weapons.flavorText:
Part of a Falling star Beast's jaw, hard and shining black, fashioned into a weapon.
With its sharp point, this colossal weapon can skewer foes.

weapons.name: Ghiza's Wheel
weapons.flavorText:
Great iron wheel lined with flesh-flaying blades. Device of torture used by Inquisitor Ghiza. As the wheel spins it causes severe pain and blood loss.
The design was adopted for use as the iconic weapon wielded by Iron Virgins.

weapons.name: Giant-crusher
weapons.flavorText:
A hammer made from a boulder, used in the War against the Giants. One of the heftiest weapons in the entire Lands Between.
After the giants were quelled, and man turned against man in violence, this weapon was all but forgotten. Man has grown feeble in comparison to his forebears.

weapons.name: Great Club
weapons.flavorText:
An enormous club of hardwood. Wildly hammering foes with this striking weapon requires no dexterity; only brute force.
While it may seem sacrilegious, this weapon is said to be a withered branch of the Erdtree. Imbued with holy power, this weapon will never snap.

weapons.name: Golem's Halberd
weapons.flavorText: A great halberd of black stone crafted by a civilization now gone to ruin. Wielded by the Guardian Golem.

weapons.name: Prelate's Inferno Crozier
weapons.flavorText:
Colossal hammer with the appearance of roiling flames. Weapon of the Prelates who lead the Fire Monks. Its heft represents the weight of their guardianship.
The hammer's head is unusually substantial, and strong attacks' will fling foes into the air.

weapons.name: Rotten Greataxe
weapons.flavorText:
Greataxe designed for gladiatorial combat, now festering with scarlet rot.
Used by duelists who were exiled from the colosseum.

weapons.name: Rotten Staff
weapons.flavorText:
Ceremonial staff depicting the Erdtree in its historic radiance. It festers with scarlet rot.
Wielded by the avatars who protect the Minor Erdtrees.

weapons.name: Staff Of The Avatar
weapons.flavorText:
Ceremonial staff depicting the Erdtree in its historic radiance. Wielded by the avatars who protect the Minor Erdtrees.
The avatars, emerging in the wake of the Elden Ring's shattering, were determined to protect the withering Erdtree's offspring.

weapons.name: Troll's Hammer
weapons.flavorText:
Mining tool of stonedigger trolls used to crack bedrock.
Trolls are descended from the giants, and these were supposedly once used as ceremonial smithing tools. In the distant past, smithing was considered divine.

weapons.name: Watchdog's Staff
weapons.flavorText:
Large stone staff embedded with glintstone. Wielded by Erdtree Burial Watchdogs who protect catacombs.
The Watchdogs, battered and broken over their lengthy tenure, rule the catacombs and are even said to command the imps.

weapons.name: Bolt Of Gransax
weapons.flavorText:
Spear whittled from the weapon wielded by Gransax. One of the legendary armaments.
A great ancient dragon, Gransax once rained calamity upon the Royal Capital - the only time in historical record that Leyndell's walls have fallen. This marked the dawn of the war against dragons.

weapons.name: Celebrant's Rib-rake
weapons.flavorText:
Rake decorated with many-colored fabrics. Ceremonial tool used by dancers during the festivities of Dominula, Windmill Village.
Crafted from human bone.

weapons.name: Clayman's Harpoon
weapons.flavorText:
Harpoon with a tip made from a sharpened meteorite shard.
Wielded by the claymen who infest dynastic remains.
The blade emits a faint light and deals magic damage.

weapons.name: Cleanrot Spear
weapons.flavorText:
Spear of the Cleanrot Knights who fought alongside Malenia, Blade of Miquella.
The winged golden blade deals holy damage. The diminutive shield is blessed with an incantation that wards off rot.

weapons.name: Cross-naginata
weapons.flavorText:
Weapon consisting of a three-pronged blade affixed to a long pole. The long central blade closely resembles a katana.
A weapon of the Land of Reeds, known for its ability to be wielded as a spear while still being capable of performing slashing attacks.

weapons.name: Crystal Spear
weapons.flavorText:
Spear fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human. Enwreathed with powerful magic, its attack scales with intelligence.
The inscrutable Crystalians have but one clear purpose; to safeguard their crystals unto the end.
One theory posits that they yearn for the return of their creator who will carve for them new brethren.

weapons.name: Death Ritual Spear
weapons.flavorText:
Ritual spear used by priests of old who were permitted to come among the Deathbirds.
The priests became guardians of the birds through the rite of Death, which also serves as an oath sworn to their distant resurrection.

weapons.name: Inquisitor's Girandole
weapons.flavorText:
Instrument of torture used on nobles behind the curtain at the Volcano Manor of Mt. Gelmir.
Its numerous spikes pierce the flesh, then singe the wounds with flame. The smell of burnt blood induces despair in the victim. A candlestick conceived by a thorough mind.

weapons.name: Iron Spear
weapons.flavorText:
Commonly used iron spear with no notable traits.
The blade is severely rusted.

weapons.name: Partisan
weapons.flavorText:
Spear with a wide tip.
In addition to its thrusting attacks, this highly versatile weapon can be swung to sweep through foes.

weapons.name: Pike
weapons.flavorText:
A longspear featuring an especially lengthy handle.
Specialized for use from long distances, it boasts the longest reach of any melee weapon.

weapons.name: Rotten Crystal Spear
weapons.flavorText:
Spear fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human. It festers with scarlet rot.
Enwreathed with powerful magic, its attack scales with intelligence.

weapons.name: Short Spear
weapons.flavorText:
An exceedingly plain spear of modest weight.
Simple to wield compared to many of its peers, its strong attack unleashes a series of successive piercing thrusts.

weapons.name: Spear
weapons.flavorText:
Weapon comprised of a blade attached to a long haft.
A far-reaching piercing weapon, it can be wielded from behind the safety of a raised shield. Very effective against mounted foes.

weapons.name: Spiked Spear
weapons.flavorText:
Weapon comprised of a spiked cylinder attached to a long pole. Capable of dealing strike damage when swung. The spikes induce blood loss.
Weapon of the Marionette Soldiers employed by sorcerers.

weapons.name: Torchpole
weapons.flavorText:
Torch fastened to a long pole. Lights up dark areas, but cannot be raised overhead.
Used by soldiers on watch, its attacks set foes aflame.

weapons.name: Lance
weapons.flavorText: Considered a type of greatspear, this weapon has no blade, but instead features a long, conical body designed to pierce.

weapons.name: Mohgwyn's Sacred Spear
weapons.flavorText:
Trident of Mohg, Lord of Blood. A sacred spear that will come to symbolize his dynasty. As well as serving as a weapon, it is an instrument of communion with an outer god who bestows power upon accursed blood.
The mother of truth desires a wound.

weapons.name: Serpent-hunter
weapons.flavorText:
Weapon that serves as both greatsword and spear. Thought tohave been used to hunt an immortal great serpent in the distantpast, it manifests a long blade of light when facing such a creature.
When their master's heroic aspirations degenerated into meregreed, his men searched for a weapon with which they might halttheir lord.

weapons.name: Siluria's Tree
weapons.flavorText:
Siluria's Tree, weapon of one of the two honored as foremost among the Crucible Knights.
The primordial form of the Erdtree is close in nature to life itself, and this spear, modeled on its crucible, is imbued with ancient holy essence

weapons.name: Treespear
weapons.flavorText: Golden spear with tree-like design. Wielded by knights employed as palace guards in the Royal Capital of Leyndell. Deals holy damage.

weapons.name: Vyke's War Spear
weapons.flavorText:
War spear singed and blistered by fingers, used by Vyke, Knight of the Roundtable Hold.
Like Vyke himself, it has been tormented by the yellow flame of frenzy from within.

weapons.name: Banished Knight's Halberd
weapons.flavorText:
A finely-crafted halberd intricately engraved with an ancient motif.
Given to knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.
Most of these knights were sent to the fringes, where they were forced to start anew with only despair for company.

weapons.name: Commander's Standard
weapons.flavorText:
A beaten red battle standard is furled around this time-worn halberd.
Even after his lord was fled, Commander O'Neil continued to brandish this flag in the devastation of the rot-eaten field of battle, the sole veteran who remembers this battle with pride.

weapons.name: Dragon Halberd
weapons.flavorText:
Halberd shaped like a dragon, enwreathed with both ice and lightning.
Alas, the Dragonkin Soldiers never attained immortality, and perished as decrepit, pale imitations of their skyborn kin.

weapons.name: Gargoyle's Black Halberd
weapons.flavorText:
Bronze halberd wielded by Valiant Gargoyles, mended with blackened corpse wax. Deals holy damage.
Such is the mark of those who serve Maliketh, the Black Blade.

weapons.name: Gargoyle's Halberd
weapons.flavorText:
Bronze halberd wielded by Valiant Gargoyles.
Just like the wielder, the missing parts have been mended with corpse wax; a patchwork of champions.

weapons.name: Glaive
weapons.flavorText:
Weapon comprised of a sharp blade affixed to a long grip. It is in fact a sickle repurposed to be a tool of war.
This far-reaching weapon excels at slashing attacks.

weapons.name: Golden Halberd
weapons.flavorText:
Weighty halberd forged of gold. Wielded by the Order of Tree Sentinels, heavily equipped knights. Deals holy damage.
A masterfully crafted weapon that lives up to its heft, but is difficult for one mere human strength to wield.

weapons.name: Guardian's Swordspear
weapons.flavorText:
Weapon comprising a long handle and broad blade sharpened from the hard wood of old trees.
Wielded by guardians of the Minor Erdtrees, known as experts in the arts of combat. The power of this weapon scales greatly with dexterity.

weapons.name: Guardian's Halberd
weapons.flavorText: In-game weapon description.

weapons.name: Halberd
weapons.flavorText:
A long-handled polearm that combines the functions of both axe and spear.
Can be used to press a single enemy with continuous thrusting attacks or swept at groups, taking advantage of its great reach and cleaving blade. A versatile weapon for any situation.

weapons.name: Loretta's War Sickle
weapons.flavorText:
Intricately crafted silver war sickle wielded by Loretta, Knight of the Haligtree.
Originally given for service as a personal guard to Carian royalty, the weapon's blue glintstone has been replaced with unalloyed gold.

weapons.name: Lucerne
weapons.flavorText:
This polearm features a hard, sharpened beak-like spike attached to its head, designed to pierce armor.
Though designed mainly as a thrusting weapon, its long handle can be utilized to get around an enemy's guard with a sideward sweeping attack.

weapons.name: Nightrider Glaive
weapons.flavorText:
A jet-black glaive with a blade as weighty as a bludgeon. Weapon of the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds.
This glaive excels at weighty slash attacks that crash into foes, making it a powerful weapon even on horse back.

weapons.name: Pest's Glaive
weapons.flavorText:
Glaive made from a hard, sharpened shell. Wielded by the pests who emerged from the Swamp of Aeonia. Slightly increases non-physical damage negation.
Though men might recognize the keen intellect of the pests evidenced by this spear's uncanny design, it will never be understood by them.

weapons.name: Ripple Crescent Halberd
weapons.flavorText:
Weapon wielded by young Albinaurics.
The blade is said to resemble a partial image of a ripple, and its attack power scales with one's arcane attribute.

weapons.name: Vulgar Militia Saw
weapons.flavorText:
A weapon comprised of a saw blade attached to a long grip. Brandished by the vulgar militia, its serrated edge is very effective at inflicting blood loss.
The saw is said to also be used to cut up bodies to feed the militia, but there are no firsthand witnesses to confirm the dire rumor.

weapons.name: Vulgar Militia Shotel
weapons.flavorText:
A hooked blade attached to a long handle. Wielded by the vulgar militia, its attacks can slip through an enemy's guard.
The vulgar militia are the undecorated stewards of rancid, scorched battlefields that none dare approach, and forbidden domains better forgotten by the rest of the world

weapons.name: Grave Scythe
weapons.flavorText: Greatscythe comprised of a large blade affixed to a crooked stick. Weapon wielded by the aged grave keepers who tend the forgotten graveyards throughout the Lands Between. This weapon is said to have served as a charm against evil spirits in times of old.

weapons.name: Halo Scythe
weapons.flavorText:
War scythe of the Cleanrot Knights who fought alongside Malenia, Blade of Miquella.
This was the weapon of commanders in Malenia's army, and the half-halo blade deals holy damage.

weapons.name: Scythe
weapons.flavorText:
Large scythe featuring a long, slender blade. Designed to reap, this weapon is capable of rapidly inflicting blood loss while also slipping through an enemy's guard.
In the hands of a highly dexterous wielder it is capable of striking fear into the heart of any foe.

weapons.name: Winged Scythe
weapons.flavorText:
Sacred scythe resembling a pair of white wings. Deals holy damage.
According to pagan belief, white-winged maidens are said to be Death's gentle envoys.

weapons.name: Giant's Red Braid
weapons.flavorText:
Hefty whip woven from the flame-red hair of a Fire Giant.
Every giant is red of hair, and Radagon was said to have despised his own red locks.
Perhaps that was a curse of their kind.

weapons.name: Hoslow's Petal Whip
weapons.flavorText:
Metal whip formed of razor-sharp chain-link blades that have the appearance of flower petals. This work of art is handed down though the generations of the illustrious House Hoslow.
"The tale of House Hoslow is told in blood."

weapons.name: Magma Whip Candlestick
weapons.flavorText:
This ritual implement is a three pronged candlestick with solid flames formed of the magma of Mt. Gelmir.
When wielded as a weapon, the flames become supple whips of lava.

weapons.name: Thorned Whip
weapons.flavorText:
Hefty whip covered in crimson thorns. Weapon of the Prelates who lead the Fire Monks.
A device of fearsome religious encouragement, it is fashioned in the image of the briars of sin.

Very effective at inflicting blood loss.

weapons.name: Urumi
weapons.flavorText:
This weapon made of extremely thin, flexible blades of metal is wielded like a whip by Nightfolk warriors.
Though in essence a whip with a cutting edge, it can also be used as a spear to pierce foes.

weapons.name: Whip
weapons.flavorText:
A leather whip. Not originally used for combat, but as an instrument of pain.
Through its supple attacks cannot be thwarted by parrying or even guarding, it is incapable of dealing critical hits.

weapons.name: Caestus
weapons.flavorText:
A weapon built for striking with the fists, made of tough leather inlaid with iron rivets.
Fist weapons come in pairs, and two-handing this weapon will equip it to both hands.

weapons.name: Cipher Pata
weapons.flavorText:
One of the weapons originating from the Two Fingers. A formless sequence of ciphers comprise its blade, and as such no shield can repel it. Deals holy damage.
The furtive inscription appears to hang in the air; the language of light spoken by the Two Fingers.

weapons.name: Clinging Bone
weapons.flavorText:
Horrific weapon made of a hardened skeletal arm. Wielded by Ensha of the Royal Remains.
Fitted by placing one's hands into the fists' grips until they dig in. "O clinging creature. A king relinquishes not the hand."

weapons.name: Grafted Dragon
weapons.flavorText: The embodiment of the power that still remained in the dragon's head that was grafted to Godrick's left arm.

weapons.name: Iron Ball
weapons.flavorText:
Iron manifer of spherical shape. Big Boggart the blackguard's weapon of choice.
Not a weapon to be taken lightly, as its weighty blows shatter bones with ease.

weapons.name: Katar
weapons.flavorText: Imported dagger design with a rather unique handle. The blade can be swung about as the extension of one's fist.

weapons.name: Spiked Caestus
weapons.flavorText:
A Caestus with the rivets replaced by blood loss-inducing spikes.
Fists weapons come in pairs, and two-handing this weapon will equip it to both hands.

weapons.name: Star Fist
weapons.flavorText:
Spherical iron manifer covered in spikes which induce blood loss.
Used in brutal games of pugilism.

weapons.name: Veteran's Prosthesis
weapons.flavorText:
Bladed prosthetic leg enwreathed with the power of lightning, instead attached to the fist.
Commander Niall, veteran of Castle Sol, offered this prosthesis in exchange for the lives of defeated knights held prisoner. He went on to lead these men as an army of no nation.

weapons.name: Bloodhound Claws
weapons.flavorText:
Large curved claws used by Bloodhound Knights.
The curve allows the weapon to slip through an enemy's guard.

weapons.name: Hookclaws
weapons.flavorText:
Weapon worn on the fist comprised of sharp parallel blades favored by those who lurk in the dark. Lacerations cause blood loss with great effect. 
Claw weapons come in pairs, and two-handing this weapon will equip it to both hands.

weapons.name: Raptor Talons
weapons.flavorText:
Claw comprised of two sharp, thin blades, wielded by the assassins of Ravenmount, this weapon allows them to imitate the attacks of Deathbirds.
Besides excelling at airborne attacks, its charge attack mimics the vicious swoop of a bird of prey.

weapons.name: Venomous Fang
weapons.flavorText:
One of the weapons designed for gladiatorial combat. Used by duelists who were exiled from the colosseum.
The black fang protruding from the bronze snake head is coated in deadly poison.

weapons.name: Composite Bow
weapons.flavorText:
Bow composited from a mix of Materials.
Demands high attributes, and is tricky to wield, but is a fearsome tool when mastered.

weapons.name: Harp Bow
weapons.flavorText:
Bow fashioned from a minstrel's harp. Sonorous tones still resound when firing arrows.
Troubadours sing tales of champions, both in the honorable service of the Erdtree, and the one who spurns honor for blasphemy.

weapons.name: Misbegotten Shortbow
weapons.flavorText:
Shortbow wielded by Winged Misbegotten. Fine fur clings to it.
Designed to inflict additional damage by sacrificing range.

weapons.name: Red Branch Shortbow
weapons.flavorText: Shortbow of polished red wood. Fashioned by a master craftsman and wielded by pages.

weapons.name: Shortbow
weapons.flavorText: Small bow made to fire arrows over great distances. Other than its ability to fire off arrows in rapid succession, it is also well-suited for use on horseback.

weapons.name: Albinauric Bow
weapons.flavorText:
Longbow featuring delicate silverwork. Wielded by Albinauric wolfback archers.
This bow requires dexterity over strength to master.

weapons.name: Black Bow
weapons.flavorText:
Longbow carved from black wood to resemble a blade. One of the most difficult bows to master.
The blade-like body of the bow is light and cuts through the air. Though a longbow, it can be wielded similarly to a shortbow.

weapons.name: Erdtree Bow
weapons.flavorText: Longbow featuring Erdtree styling. In times of old, when faith and battle went hand in hand, this weapon was created in tandem with the Golden Arrow.

weapons.name: Horn Bow
weapons.flavorText: Longbow made from animal horn. Wielded by the master hunters of the ancestral followers.

weapons.name: Longbow
weapons.flavorText: Longbow made to fire arrows over great distances. Compared to a shortbow, arrows fired reach further and deal more damage.

weapons.name: Pulley Bow
weapons.flavorText:
Longbow which utilizes a series of pulleys and strings. The complex mechanism, which required advanced mathematical and mechanical understanding to craft, was likely made by a certain genius who learned Golden Order Fundamentalism.
Enhances precision while shooting, enabling arrows to fly much further distances.

weapons.name: Serpent Bow
weapons.flavorText:
Malformed bow in the shape of a pair of poisonous snakes. Imbues arrows with poison through pagan magic, revealing its true worth when used with poison-infused arrows.
Used by assassins known as the Formless Serpents.

weapons.name: Erdtree Greatbow
weapons.flavorText:
Greatbow featuring Erdtree styling. In times of old, when faith and battle went hand in hand, this weapon was created in tandem with the Golden Great Arrow.
Scales all arrow damage with faith, revealing its true worth when used with holy-infused arrows.

weapons.name: Golem Greatbow
weapons.flavorText:
Greatbow of black stone crafted by a civilization now gone to ruin. Weapon of the Guardian Golem.
Extremely heavy, this greatbow requires enormous strength just to draw, suggesting it was not designed for human use.

weapons.name: Greatbow
weapons.flavorText:
Enormous greatbow larger than any man. Can not be drawn with any ordinary level of strength, but the force of its shots is extraordinary.
A greatbow can only fire great arrows.

weapons.name: Lion Greatbow
weapons.flavorText:
Greatbow of black iron wielded by General Radahn. Decorated with a lion mane motif.
Imbued with gravitational power of the Starscourge, when used along with Radahn's Spear, it becomes a true weapon of a champion.

weapons.name: Arbalest
weapons.flavorText:
Large crossbow made from composite materials. One of the largest of all bolt firing devices.
Its limbs are more pliable than metallic ones, allowing bolts fired from this weapon to pierce even forged of steel.

weapons.name: Crepus's Black-key Crossbow
weapons.flavorText:
Black crossbow featuring a long stock. Used for sniping, it has a very long range.
Weapon of Crepus, who served the Two Fingers from the shadows of the Roundtable as the head confessor.

weapons.name: Heavy Crossbow
weapons.flavorText:
Heavy crossbow with iron limbs, increasing damage dealt.
Commonly employed in the Shattering.

weapons.name: Light Crossbow
weapons.flavorText: Ranged weapon made from a bow fixed to a stock. Deals good damage and is simple to use, but requires reloading after firing.

weapons.name: Soldier's Crossbow
weapons.flavorText: A crossbow of simple make, usable by anyone, but lacking in both power and accuracy.

weapons.name: Hand Ballista
weapons.flavorText:
An unconventional ballistic device modeled on a weapon used to besiege castles. Only capable of firing greatbolts.
Perfect for reckless acts such as storming a castle or facing an entire army alone.

catalysts.name: Academy Glintstone Staff
catalysts.flavorText:
Staff of the Academy of Raya Lucaria, embedded with a turquoise glintstone.
Each staff holds the memories of two sorceries. Use normal and strong attacks to cast them.

catalysts.name: Albinauric Staff
catalysts.flavorText:
Short staff with a blue glintstone embedded. Wielded by the albinaurics of old.
The albinaurics harbor a secret; they cast sorcery with their innate arcaneness.

catalysts.name: Astrologer's Staff
catalysts.flavorText:
Staff of the astrologers. A glintsone is embedded in the tip, enabling it to be used as a catalyst for sorceries.
Each staff holds the memories of two sorceries. Use normal and strong attacks to cast them.

catalysts.name: Azur's Glintstone Staff
catalysts.flavorText: Staff of the primeval glintstone sorcerer Azur. Only those who have glimpsed what lies beyond the wisdom of stone may wield it.

catalysts.name: Carian Glintblade Staff
catalysts.flavorText:
Staff embedded with a blue glintstone. One of two types of Carian staff.
Gifted to enchanted knights, it enhances Glintblade sorceries.

catalysts.name: Carian Glintstone Staff
catalysts.flavorText:
Staff embedded with a blue glintstone. One of two types of Carian staff.
Given to sorcerers that they might enact the role of knight. Enhances Carian sword sorceries.

catalysts.name: Carian Regal Scepter
catalysts.flavorText:
Magic scepter of Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon. The glintstone is known as a Carian Blue, enhancing full moon sorceries.
Only those of the highest intelligence may wield this, the finest of all glintstone staves.

catalysts.name: Crystal Staff
catalysts.flavorText:
Staff fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human. Enhances Crystalian sorceries.
The Crystalian's faint cognition is known as the "wisdom of stone." This staff can only be wielded by those of intellect high enough to grasp such wisdom.

catalysts.name: Demi-human Queen's Staff
catalysts.flavorText:
Glintstone staff styled as a scepter. A gift once given to the demi-humans to foster peace, it can be wielded even by those of low intelligence.
Sneered at by fools in the academy.

catalysts.name: Digger's Staff
catalysts.flavorText: Staff of a sorcerer-miner who extracts glintstone from crystal tunnels. The staff itself is a tool used to mine, and the ferrule is also embedded with a glintstone.

catalysts.name: Gelmir Glintstone Staff
catalysts.flavorText: Staff wielded by the Man-Serpents of Mt. Gelmir. It has a forked tip, and is embedded with red glintstones.

catalysts.name: Glintstone Staff
catalysts.flavorText:
Staff with a glintstone embedded at the tip. A catalyst for casting sorceries.
Each staff holds the memories of two sorceries. Use normal and strong attacks to cast them.

catalysts.name: Lusat's Glintstone Staff
catalysts.flavorText: Staff of the primeval glintstone sorcerer Lusat. Only those who have glimpsed what lies beyond the wisdom of stone may wield it.

catalysts.name: Meteorite Staff
catalysts.flavorText: Staff embedded with a dark purple glintstone, said to be the fragment of a meteorite.

catalysts.name: Prince Of Death's Staff
catalysts.flavorText:
Staff embedded with sullied amber, said to be a very part of the Prince of Death.
One of the staves deemed heretical by the academy.

catalysts.name: Rotten Crystal Staff
catalysts.flavorText: Staff fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human. It festers with scarlet rot.

catalysts.name: Staff Of Loss
catalysts.flavorText: Staff missing its glintstone. Wielded by sorcerers who believe that discovery comes through acts of asceticism.

catalysts.name: Staff Of The Guilty
catalysts.flavorText: A heretical staff fashioned from a smoldering, withered sapling that turns the blood of sacrifices pierced by it into glintstone. Similar to hex magic.

shields.name: Blue-white Wooden Shield
shields.flavorText:
Small wooden roundshield that has been reinforced with metal. It is light and easy to handle, but cannot offer the damage negation of a true metal shield.
The design is said to represent the stars of the night sky, portending fate.

shields.name: Buckler
shields.flavorText:
A small metal roundshield. The bump in the center enables parrying techniques.
A well-timed parry can break an enemy's stance, allowing a critical hit. Best suited for those prepared to take the risk to reap their reward.

shields.name: Coil Shield
shields.flavorText: Armament designed for gladiatorial combat. rises above its peers as a particularly showy specimen.

shields.name: Gilded Iron Shield
shields.flavorText:
Small metal roundshield. Heavier than a wooden shield, but boasts higher damage negation.
Though the gold leaf is peeling and the effect is slight, it still boosts holy damage negation.

shields.name: Ice Crest Shield
shields.flavorText:
Small metal roundshield. Heavier than a wooden shield, but boasts higher damage negation.
The ice crest originates from a Carian princess. Though the effect is slight, it boosts magic damage negation and resistance to frost.

shields.name: Iron Roundshield
shields.flavorText:
An ordinary small roundshield made of metal. Heavier than a wooden shield, but boasts higher damage negation.
Finely balanced, this shield is easy to use.

shields.name: Man-serpent's Shield
shields.flavorText:
Small copper dome-shaped roundshield carried by the man-serpents of Mt. Gelmir.
Said to have been tempered in lava, it boasts great resistance to fire.

shields.name: Perfumer's Shield
shields.flavorText:
Golden shield used by the perfumers of Leyndell during military service.
Made to be thin and light of weight, even those lacking strength can employ this immunity-boosting shield.

shields.name: Pillory Shield
shields.flavorText:
Pillory made to punish serious felons, used as a shield. Though made of good, sturdy wood, it is only a makeshift tool and performs as such.
Perhaps due to its use as a device with which the guilty were made to endure prolonged suffering, it raises vitality.

shields.name: Red Thorn Roundshield
shields.flavorText:
A small, wooden roundshield. It is light and easy to use, but cannot offer the damage negation of a metal shield.
Its emblem is an ancient red thorn design. Though it isn't much, it boosts fire damage negation.

shields.name: Rickety Shield
shields.flavorText:
A creaky old wooden shield, circular in shape. Roughly reinforced with vines or some such.
There are countless other shields available of better make. This piece of scrap isn't worth the effort of equipping.

shields.name: Rift Shield
shields.flavorText:
Small metal roundshiled depicting a sinister rift.
An antiquated charm that glares back at an enemy.

shields.name: Riveted Wooden Shield
shields.flavorText:
Small wooden roundshield that has been reinforced with metal. It is light and easy to handle, but cannot offer the damage negation of a true metal shield. 
The design riveted to the center represents both sword and tree.

shields.name: Scripture Wooden Shield
shields.flavorText:
A small, wooden roundshield. It is light and easy to handle, but cannot offer the damage negation of a metal shield.
An ancient cipher engraving lines the circumference. Though it isn't much, it boosts holy damage negation.

shields.name: Shield Of The Guilty
shields.flavorText:
Shield made to venerate a maiden whose eyes were crushed by Briars of Sin before being reborn in these lands.
Venerating the repose of the soul. The briars can be used to attack foes.

shields.name: Smoldering Shield
shields.flavorText:
Small shield made upon Mt. Gelmir forged from uncooling lava.
Resists frost with its heat, and can even be used to deal fire damage if wielded as a weapon.

shields.name: Spiralhorn Shield
shields.flavorText:
Small shield of antlers arranged in an eddy-like pattern. If used to attack a foe, the shield's antlers inflict blood loss.
Once given to a Tarnished warrior who cultivated close ties to the ancestral followers.

shields.name: Wylder's Small Shield
shields.flavorText: Description go here.

shields.name: Albinauric Shield
shields.flavorText:
Tall oval shield made of metal carried by young Albinaurics. The ornamentation represents the primordial drop of dew from which they are said to have been created.
Boasts exceptional magic damage negation. The Albinaurics' most formidable foes were sorcerers, after all.

shields.name: Banished Knight's Shield
shields.flavorText:
A tall medium-sized metal shield. Given to knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.
Most of these knights were sent to the fringes, where they were forced to start anew with only despair for company.

shields.name: Beast Crest Heater Shield
shields.flavorText:
A medium-sized metal shield. Easier to handle than a kite shield.
Features a beast as its crest, serving to remind warriors not to succumb to the arousal of battle. Fight with passion, but become not its prisoner.

shields.name: Beastman's Jar-shield
shields.flavorText:
Shield fashioned from a tall broken jar carried by the beastmen of Farum Azula. There is a particular knack to wielding it.
The beastmen have always fired earthenware jars for the express purpose of making shields. Such are their ways, strange though they are.

shields.name: Black Leather Shield
shields.flavorText:
Roundshield covered in black leather. On the larger side for a medium-sized shield.
From the north, this shield depicts the polar star in rivets of gold. The inside is lined with fur, protecting the carrier from frost.

shields.name: Blue Crest Heater Shield
shields.flavorText:
A medium-sized metal shield. Easier to handle than a kite shield. 
The crest represents a forest and river.

shields.name: Blue-gold Kite Shield
shields.flavorText:
A standard medium-sized shield. Highly reputed for its solid build and reliability.
